text: this is ellen berry a correspondent for
the New York Times outside the socket
District Court in New Delhi a judge
rendered a verdict in the now notorious
gang rape case that took place here last
December all four of the defendants were
found guilty on all of the charges
against them this was a case that
because of its horrifying detail really
galvanized people in New Delhi and
resulted in a surprising outpouring of
anger from street protesters last
December
people in part were identified very
closely with the life story of this
young woman a 23 year old daughter of a
labourer who I'm from the village to the
city and was hoping ultimately to become
a physiotherapist for the nine months
that have elapsed since then the issue
of rape and violence against women has
risen to the top of the national agenda
in India but all this will reach its
culmination on Wednesday when the answer
to the last question whether the
defendants received the death penalty
becomes clear
